criteria: Accuracy in applying differentiation rules for higher-order derivatives.
Ability to correctly identify and apply the chain rule, product rule, and quotient rule where necessary.
Clarity and correctness in notation and mathematical presentation.
Simplification and algebraic manipulation skills after differentiation.
descriptions: No attempt or demonstrates no understanding of differentiation rules.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of basic differentiation rules; frequent errors.
Applies basic differentiation rules with some errors, especially in complex functions.
Generally applies differentiation rules correctly, with occasional minor errors.
Applies differentiation rules accurately for most functions, including chain rule and product rule.
Consistently and accurately applies differentiation rules to find higher-order derivatives of complex functions.
Fails to identify or apply chain, product, or quotient rules.
Attempts to apply chain, product, or quotient rules, but with significant errors.
Applies chain, product, or quotient rules inconsistently and with frequent errors.
Applies chain, product, and quotient rules with some accuracy, but may struggle with more complex problems.
Correctly identifies and applies chain, product, and quotient rules in most situations.
Masterfully identifies and applies chain, product, and quotient rules, even in complex and multi-layered problems.
Notation is unclear or incorrect; work is disorganized and difficult to follow.
Notation contains errors; work is somewhat disorganized.
Notation is generally correct, but some inconsistencies are present; work is adequately organized.
Correct notation is used, and work is generally well-organized and easy to follow.
Clear and correct notation is consistently used; work is well-organized and easy to follow.
Exemplary use of notation; work is exceptionally clear, concise, and well-organized, enhancing understanding.
Unable to simplify or manipulate expressions after differentiation.
Attempts simplification, but with significant errors.
Simplifies expressions with some errors; struggles with more complex algebraic manipulations.
Simplifies expressions correctly in most cases, with occasional minor errors.
Consistently simplifies expressions accurately after differentiation.
Demonstrates excellent algebraic manipulation skills, simplifying complex expressions efficiently and accurately.
